text:
Rules for a tank

  • Fish need space to swim
  • Tanks need space at the top to account for waves and to stop fish from escaping
  • Tanks should include rocks, plants, and other decorations
  • Fish need clean water in order to breathe

Two popular guidelines for ensuring enough water

  • 1 gallon of water per inch of fish, or
  • 6-10 gallons of water per pound of fish

The donor’s suggested assumptions

  • Fish are 3D, but the inch rule will apply to the length of the fish
  • Fish are different sizes, but you can assume for now that all the fish will be identical
  • Assume the water guidelines are for when the fish are full grown
  • Estimating tank volume to the nearest 25 gallons is sufficient
Note: The plural form of fish is “fish,” not “fishes.”
